TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ViewEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides event data that is used as a parameter object in the and events of the root object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class is exposed as the `e` parameter in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.AxisViewChanged> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.AxisViewChanging> events. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.AxisViewChanging> event is raised just before a new view is displayed, as a result of the end-user clicking and dragging in a chart area. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.AxisViewChanged> event is raised just after the new view is created.
It is important to note that the position and size of a view cannot be set in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.AxisViewChanged> event because in this case the view is already created.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ViewEventArgs> class contains the following properties:
- The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ViewEventArgs.ChartArea%2A> property, which is used to get the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object in which the view is being displayed. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.Name%2A> property gets the name of the chart area. Other chart area properties can also be set.
- The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ViewEventArgs.Axis%2A> property, which is used to get the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis> object with which the view is associated. To determine the type of axis, which can be X, Y, X2 or Y2, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.AxisName%2A> property. Other axis properties can also be set.
- The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ViewEventArgs.NewPosition%2A> property, which represents the new position of a view.
- The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ViewEventArgs.NewSize%2A> property, which represents the new size of a view.
- The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ViewEventArgs.NewSizeType%2A> property, which represents the unit of measurement for the size of a view.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Axis As Axis

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the object that a view belongs to.
Docs.value: An object that represents the axis that a view belongs to.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is exposed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.AxisViewChanged> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.AxisViewChanging> events of the root <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> object.
This property can be used to:
- Determine the type of axis - X, X2, Y or Y2 - that the event is being raised for, using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.AxisName%2A> property.
- Get and set axis properties, such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.LineColor%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ChartArea As ChartArea

Docs.summary: Gets the object that a view belongs to.
Docs.value: A object that represents the chart area a view belongs to.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is exposed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.AxisViewChanged> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.AxisViewChanging> events of the root <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ScrollBarEventArgs.ChartArea%2A> property can be used to determine the chart area that the view belongs to, by accessing the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.Name> property. This property can also be used to get and set chart area properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property double NewPosition { double get(); void set(double value); };
member this.NewPosition : double with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the new position of a view along an axis.
Docs.value: A value that represents the position of a view along an axis, which is either the bottom of a vertical view or the left position of a horizontal view.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is exposed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.AxisViewChanged> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.AxisViewChanging> events of the root <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> object, and represents the new position of a view.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ViewEventArgs.NewPosition%2A> property can be set to a new value in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.AxisViewChanging> event, but cannot be set to a new value for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.AxisViewChanged> event because in this case the view is already created.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ViewEventArgs.NewPosition%2A> is always measured as an axis value.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property double NewSize { double get(); void set(double value); };
member this.NewSize : double with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the size of a view along an axis.
Docs.value: A value that represents the size of a view along an axis. The size is either the height of the vertical view or the width of the horizontal view.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Windows::Forms::DataVisualization::Charting::DateTimeIntervalType NewSizeType { System::Windows::Forms::DataVisualization::Charting::DateTimeIntervalType get(); void set(System::Windows::Forms::DataVisualization::Charting::DateTimeIntervalType value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the unit of measurement for the new size of a view.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that represents the unit of measurement for the property, which represents the width or height of a data view. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When this property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.DateTimeIntervalType.Auto>, the unit of measurement for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ViewEventArgs.NewSize%2A> property is automatically determined by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control, and will be either a number or a day.
Recall that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ViewEventArgs.NewSize%2A> property is always measured as an axis value. Make sure that if you explicitly set the size type, the type matches the axis that the scrollbar belongs to. In other words, do not specify <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.DateTimeIntervalType.Minutes> if the axis does not use <xref:System.DateTime> values.
Note that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ViewEventArgs.NewSize%2A> property can be set to a new value in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.AxisViewChanging> event, but cannot be set to a new value for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.AxisViewChanged> event because the view is already created.
